column3: Main GUPRI (i.e. PID) under which all terms are defined. Preference is to use PURLs or W3IDs as they provide permanent resolvable identifiers if they are properly configured and managed.

column1: Prefixes for controlled vocabularies, schema and ontologies

column4: Prefix for our controlled vocabulary since it is rather tedious to write long URLs all the time
Prefix for SKOS Onotlogy is which our base for defining SKOS based controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Provenance, Authoring and Versioning Onotlogy which properties such as version and createdOn we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Dublin Core (Terms) Ontology which properties such as title, description, rights, source, etc. we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary as well to define its terms
Prefix for "Quantity, Unit, Dimension and Type" schema that is used to model physical units.
Prefix for QUDT Vocabulary of Units which terms we will use to semantically define units of measurements for terms (i.e., variables) we are defining

column3: License under which the vocabulary is provided
Date when vocabulary was initially created (follow https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)
Date of the last vocabulary update

column5: Number given to the sample after institutes nameing standard
4 digit number representing the year the disease was observed. Automatically created from the Blight Tracker App.
2 char code as defined in the ISO standard ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes
Potato disease caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans
Potato disease caused by the fungus Alternaria solani
Potato disease just made up by MIK in order to experiment new vocab
Yet another potato disease, poor potato
